snippet: A Labor Department report suggested that inflation remained tame, however, which may lead the Fed to be more comfortable about trimming its bond purchases.
abstract: Labor Department says its Consumer Price Index rose 0.1 percent in August; report suggests that inflation remained tame, however, which may lead the Federal Reserve to be more comfortable about trimming its bond purchases.
lead_paragraph: A Labor Department report suggested that inflation remained tame, however, which may lead the Fed to be more comfortable about trimming its bond purchases.

headline.main: Medical Costs and Rents Nudge the Price Index Higher
headline.print_headline: Medical Costs and Rents Nudge the Price Index Higher
